lexUnit.name: dawn.n

document.description: Berlitz Where to Go in Hong Kong
document.name: WhereToHongKong

lexUnit.definition: COD: the first appearance of light in the sky before sunrise

sentence.text: It will only come closer around dawn .
Both Jay and Dionne had spent many a dawn listening to each other on the latest One and Only .
I was awakened shortly after dawn by Floss and Tibbs .
The Prince of Orange arrived three hours after dawn , excited at the prospect of action .
I had risen soon after dawn , as was my habit , and went walking across the rolling hilltops above the house .
She returned just after dawn .
In Polperro it was customary to rise at dawn to ` See the sun dance " .
At dawn next morning two Chinese planes came in and we got almost everyone on board and away .
She would be up at dawn and away before he woke .
Kalchu was busy all the time , working the land from dawn to dusk .
He had worked from dawn until dusk without a break .
Koresh was discreet about his sex with underage children and they left his room in the early dawn .
She woke in the early dawn and peered around her blearily through the heavy mist that filled the wood .
Rachel asked as the jet roared into take-off , leaving London behind them in a blue-grey dawn .
I had to wait till dawn to see what I was doing , " said Peter , of Taunton , Somerset , who suffered minor injuries .
She lay awake till dawn thinking about it .
They danced almost till dawn , till there was no more champagne and almost all of the other guests had long gone home .
Waves of sleep then started to wash over me and I dozed fitfully until dawn .
We wandered round the streets until dawn .
When they came ashore they found the A - Ma Temple ( properly called Ma Kok Temple ; open daily dawn to dusk ) , dedicated to the favorite goddess of fishermen , who is also known as Tin Hau .
